an4.93:1.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.93:1.3: One person has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.
an4.93:1.4: One person has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.
an4.93:1.5: One person has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.
an4.93:1.6: One person has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.
an4.93:2.1: As for the person who has serenity but not discernment: grounded on serenity, they should practice meditation to get discernment.
an4.93:2.2: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.
an4.93:3.1: As for the person who has discernment but not serenity: grounded on discernment, they should practice meditation to get serenity.
an4.93:3.2: After some time they have both discernment and serenity.
an4.93:4.1: As for the person who has neither serenity nor discernment: in order to get those skillful qualities, they should apply outstanding enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
an4.93:4.2: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply intense enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.
an4.93:4.3: In the same way, in order to get those skillful qualities, that person should apply outstanding enthusiasm …
an4.93:4.4: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.
an4.93:5.1: As for the person who has both serenity and discernment: grounded on those skillful qualities, they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.
an4.93:5.2: These are the four people found in the world.”
